proteinInfo.activeSiteText: In the sequence table at the top of this page click on each amino acid starting with the 1st and ending with the 30th. This region of MC1R includes signal peptides and may be involved in initial ligand binding and receptor activation. The MC1R protein is a G-protein-coupled receptor (GPCR), and its function relies on the transmembrane domains and extracellular loops where it can interact with melanocortin peptides and other ligands.
proteinInfo.proteinFunction: Eumelanin and Pheomelanin Production: Variations in the MC1R gene affect the receptor's ability to regulate the production of eumelanin and pheomelanin. Mutations can lead to a preference for pheomelanin production, resulting in red or blonde hair and fair skin, which provide less protection against UV radiation. UV Protection: Higher eumelanin production provides better UV protection, which is why individuals with darker skin have a lower risk of UV-induced skin damage.
